post.description:
This evaluator uses OpenAI's moderation API to detect potentially harmful content in text,
including harassment, hate speech, self-harm, sexual content, and violence.

post.description: This evaluator implements LLM-as-a-judge with a function call approach to check if the message contains a mention of a competitor.

post.description: A simple evaluator that checks if the output matches the expected_output exactly.

post.description: Uses an LLM to check if the generated output answers a question correctly the same way as the expected output, even if their style is different.

post.description: Use an LLM as a judge with a custom prompt to do a true/false boolean evaluation of the message.

post.description: Use an LLM as a judge with a custom prompt to classify the message into custom defined categories.

post.description: Use an LLM as a judge with custom prompt to do a numeric score evaluation of the message.

post.description: This evaluator checks if the user message is concerning one of the allowed topics of the chatbot

post.description: This evaluator checks if all the user queries in the conversation were resolved. Useful to detect when the bot doesn't know how to answer or can't help the user.

Online Evaluation

post.description:
Allows you to check for semantic similarity or dissimilarity between input and output and a
target value, so you can avoid sentences that you don't want to be present without having to
match on the exact text.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description:
Allows you to check if the output is a valid json, markdown, python, sql, etc.
For JSON, can optionally validate against a provided schema.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Traditional NLP metric. BLEU score for evaluating the similarity between two strings.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Balances between precision and recall for context retrieval, increasing it means a better signal-to-noise ratio. Uses traditional string distance metrics.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Measures how accurate is the retrieval compared to expected contexts, increasing it means less noise in the retrieval. Uses traditional string distance metrics.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Measures how many relevant contexts were retrieved compared to expected contexts, increasing it means more signal in the retrieval. Uses traditional string distance metrics.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Computes with an LLM how factually similar the generated answer is to the expected output.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This evaluator assesses the extent to which the generated answer is consistent with the provided context. Higher scores indicate better faithfulness to the context, useful for detecting hallucinations.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Uses an LLM to measure the proportion of chunks in the retrieved context that were relevant to generate the output or the expected output.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Uses an LLM to measure how many of relevant documents attributable the claims in the output were successfully retrieved in order to generate an expected output.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Evaluates how pertinent the generated answer is to the given prompt. Higher scores indicate better relevancy.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Traditional NLP metric. ROUGE score for evaluating the similarity between two strings.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Rubric-based evaluation metric that is used to evaluate responses. The rubric consists of descriptions for each score, typically ranging from 1 to 5

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment

Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Checks if the SQL query is equivalent to a reference one by using an LLM to infer if it would generate the same results given the table schemas.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Measures how well the summary captures important information from the retrieved contexts.

Online Evaluation

post.description:
This evaluator detects the language of the input and output text to check for example if the generated answer is in the same language as the prompt,
or if it's in a specific expected language.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Computes with an LLM a weighted combination of factual as well as semantic similarity between the generated answer and the expected output.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: Evaluates how pertinent the generated answer is to the given prompt. Higher scores indicate better relevancy.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This metric evaluates whether all of the ground-truth relevant items present in the contexts are ranked higher or not. Higher scores indicate better precision.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This evaluator measures the extent to which the retrieved context aligns with the annotated answer, treated as the ground truth. Higher values indicate better performance.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This metric gauges the relevancy of the retrieved context, calculated based on both the question and contexts. The values fall within the range of (0, 1), with higher values indicating better relevancy.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This metric evaluates whether all of the output relevant items present in the contexts are ranked higher or not. Higher scores indicate better utilization.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This evaluator assesses the extent to which the generated answer is consistent with the provided context. Higher scores indicate better faithfulness to the context, useful for detecting hallucinations.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description:
This evaluator detects potentially unsafe content in text, including hate speech,
self-harm, sexual content, and violence. It allows customization of the severity
threshold and the specific categories to check.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This evaluator checks for jailbreak-attempt in the input using Azure's Content Safety API.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description: This evaluator checks for prompt injection attempt in the input and the contexts using Azure's Content Safety API.

x-codeSamples.label: Experiment
Online Evaluation
Experiment
Online Evaluation

post.description:
Detects personally identifiable information in text, including phone numbers, email addresses, and
social security numbers. It allows customization of the detection threshold and the specific types of PII to check.

trace_id.description: Optional trace ID to associate this evaluation with a trace

model.description: The model version to use, `text-moderation-latest` will be automatically upgraded over time, while `text-moderation-stable` will only be updated with advanced notice by OpenAI.

categories.description: The categories of content to check for moderation.

rules.description: List of rules to check, the message must pass all of them

competitors.description: The competitors that must not be mentioned.
